description: From Middle French pulsatif, and its source, past-classical Latin pulsativus.

adjectives.description: pulsative (comparative more pulsative, superlative most pulsative)

entries.meaning: Characterised by pulsing or beating; throbbing. [from 14th c.]
examples: It was this vital spirit which was mainly responsible for creating the pulsative power within the coats of the artery.
